ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take this class! English 114 really forces you to write with clarity and purpose and it's amazing if you get the right instructor.

Yes, I learned some new skills and ways of thinking and writing. Pick a section that you're interested in. 4 essays was not actually as big a time commitment as I had expected. It's not easy to get an A.
Yes, to get a writing credit. I didn't feel like i became a "Better" writer, I just got more practice.
I don't recommend it that much, take another writing credit
Yeah definitely, its a good way to get a writing credit.
TAKE THIS COURSE. IT WILL HELP YOUR WRITING.

This is basically an intro to college writing class with a focus on a certain subject, in this case Madness and Civilization. The class is structured in way that eases us into writing essays for college. We had four major papers throughout the semester: three 4-5 page papers and one 9-10 research paper. At first it was difficult writing the papersbut by the end of the class I had a much better understanding of what it takes to write a successful paper. The research paper is on any subject you want relating to madness and generally Julia wasn't very restrictive. For example, I wrote my paper on the Hillsborough disaster involving two English soccer teams. Overall, I really enjoyed the class and I would recommend everyone to take a 114. My only advice is to choose a class focuses on a topic that really interests you since it is much easier to write about a subject that you find interesting.
I liked my English 114 course but would only recommend it to another student if they really liked the topic. After a few months, you really beat the topic dead.
